dt: {bc}to deter or frighten by pretense or a mere show of strength

dt.t: {wi}bluff{/wi} her way in without a ticket
The catcher {wi}bluffed{/wi} a throw to first.

dt: {bc}to deceive (an opponent) by a bold bet on an inferior hand

dt.t: was {wi}bluffed{/wi} out of a winning hand
You can tell when he is {wi}bluffing{/wi}.

et: probably from Dutch {it}bluffen{/it} to boast, play a kind of card game
shortdef: to deter or frighten by pretense or a mere show of strength
